title: Command Line Options
-v, --version
Added in: v0.1.3 Print node’s version.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.1.3 Print node’s version.

title: -h, --help
Added in: v0.1.3 Print node command line options. The output of this option is less detailed than this document.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.1.3 Print node command line options. The output of this option is less detailed than this document.

title: -e, --eval "script"
Added in: v0.5.2 Evaluate the following argument as JavaScript. The modules which are predefined in the REPL can also be used in script.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.5.2 Evaluate the following argument as JavaScript. The modules which are predefined in the REPL can also be used in script.

title: -p, --print "script"
Added in: v0.6.4 Identical to -e but prints the result.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.6.4 Identical to -e but prints the result.

title: -c, --check
Added in: v5.0.0 Syntax check the script without executing.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v5.0.0 Syntax check the script without executing.

title: -i, --interactive
Added in: v0.7.7 Opens the REPL even if stdin does not appear to be a terminal.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.7.7 Opens the REPL even if stdin does not appear to be a terminal.

title: -r, --require module
Added in: v1.6.0 Preload the specified module at startup.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v1.6.0 Preload the specified module at startup.

title: Follows require()’s module resolution rules. module may be either a path to a file, or a node module name.

inline_content.Text: Follows require()’s module resolution rules. module may be either a path to a file, or a node module name.

title: --no-deprecation
Added in: v0.8.0 Silence deprecation warnings.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.8.0 Silence deprecation warnings.

title: --trace-deprecation
Added in: v0.8.0 Print stack traces for deprecations.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.8.0 Print stack traces for deprecations.

title: --throw-deprecation
Added in: v0.11.14 Throw errors for deprecations.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.11.14 Throw errors for deprecations.

title: --no-warnings
Added in: v6.0.0 Silence all process warnings (including deprecations).

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Silence all process warnings (including deprecations).

title: --trace-warnings
Added in: v6.0.0 Print stack traces for process warnings (including deprecations).

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Print stack traces for process warnings (including deprecations).

title: --trace-sync-io
Added in: v2.1.0 Prints a stack trace whenever synchronous I/O is detected after the first turn of the event loop.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v2.1.0 Prints a stack trace whenever synchronous I/O is detected after the first turn of the event loop.

title: --zero-fill-buffers
Added in: v6.0.0 Automatically zero-fills all newly allocated Buffer and SlowBuffer instances.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Automatically zero-fills all newly allocated Buffer and SlowBuffer instances.

title: --preserve-symlinks
Added in: v6.3.0 Instructs the module loader to preserve symbolic links when resolving and caching modules.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.3.0 Instructs the module loader to preserve symbolic links when resolving and caching modules.

title: By default, when Node.js loads a module from a path that is symbolically linked to a different on-disk location, Node.js will dereference the link and use the actual on-disk “real path” of the module as both an identifier and as a root path to locate other dependency modules. In most cases, this default behavior is acceptable. However, when using symbolically linked peer dependencies, as illustrated in the example below, the default behavior causes an exception to be thrown if moduleA attempts to require moduleB as a peer dependency:

inline_content.Text: By default, when Node.js loads a module from a path that is symbolically linked to a different on-disk location, Node.js will dereference the link and use the actual on-disk “real path” of the module as both an identifier and as a root path to locate other dependency modules. In most cases, this default behavior is acceptable. However, when using symbolically linked peer dependencies, as illustrated in the example below, the default behavior causes an exception to be thrown if moduleA attempts to require moduleB as a peer dependency:

title:
{appDir}
 ├── app
 │   ├── index.js
 │   └── node_modules
 │       ├── moduleA -> {appDir}/moduleA
 │       └── moduleB
 │           ├── index.js
 │           └── package.json
 └── moduleA
     ├── index.js
     └── package.json

content_resolved.code:
{appDir}
 ├── app
 │   ├── index.js
 │   └── node_modules
 │       ├── moduleA -> {appDir}/moduleA
 │       └── moduleB
 │           ├── index.js
 │           └── package.json
 └── moduleA
     ├── index.js
     └── package.json

title: The –preserve-symlinks command line flag instructs Node.js to use the symlink path for modules as opposed to the real path, allowing symbolically linked peer dependencies to be found.

inline_content.Text: The –preserve-symlinks command line flag instructs Node.js to use the symlink path for modules as opposed to the real path, allowing symbolically linked peer dependencies to be found.

title: Note, however, that using –preserve-symlinks can have other side effects. Specifically, symbolically linked native modules can fail to load if those are linked from more than one location in the dependency tree (Node.js would see those as two separate modules and would attempt to load the module multiple times, causing an exception to be thrown).

inline_content.Text: Note, however, that using –preserve-symlinks can have other side effects. Specifically, symbolically linked native modules can fail to load if those are linked from more than one location in the dependency tree (Node.js would see those as two separate modules and would attempt to load the module multiple times, causing an exception to be thrown).

title: --track-heap-objects
Added in: v2.4.0 Track heap object allocations for heap snapshots.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v2.4.0 Track heap object allocations for heap snapshots.

title: --prof-process
Added in: v6.0.0 Process v8 profiler output generated using the v8 option –prof.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Process v8 profiler output generated using the v8 option –prof.

title: --v8-options
Added in: v0.1.3 Print v8 command line options.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.1.3 Print v8 command line options.

title: Note: v8 options allow words to be separated by both dashes (-) or underscores (_).

inline_content.Text: Note: v8 options allow words to be separated by both dashes (-) or underscores (_).

title: For example, –stack-trace-limit is equivalent to –stack_trace_limit.

inline_content.Text: For example, –stack-trace-limit is equivalent to –stack_trace_limit.

title: --tls-cipher-list=list
Added in: v4.0.0 Specify an alternative default TLS cipher list. (Requires Node.js to be built with crypto support. (Default))

inline_content.Text: Added in: v4.0.0 Specify an alternative default TLS cipher list. (Requires Node.js to be built with crypto support. (Default))

title: --enable-fips
Added in: v6.0.0 Enable FIPS-compliant crypto at startup. (Requires Node.js to be built with ./configure –openssl-fips)

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Enable FIPS-compliant crypto at startup. (Requires Node.js to be built with ./configure –openssl-fips)

title: --force-fips
Added in: v6.0.0 Force FIPS-compliant crypto on startup. (Cannot be disabled from script code.) (Same requirements as –enable-fips)

inline_content.Text: Added in: v6.0.0 Force FIPS-compliant crypto on startup. (Cannot be disabled from script code.) (Same requirements as –enable-fips)

title: --icu-data-dir=file
Added in: v0.11.15 Specify ICU data load path. (overrides NODE_ICU_DATA)

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.11.15 Specify ICU data load path. (overrides NODE_ICU_DATA)

title:
Environment Variables

NODE_DEBUG=module[,…]
Added in: v0.1.32 ‘,’-separated list of core modules that should print debug information.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.1.32 ‘,’-separated list of core modules that should print debug information.

title: NODE_PATH=path[:…]
Added in: v0.1.32 ‘:’-separated list of directories prefixed to the module search path.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.1.32 ‘:’-separated list of directories prefixed to the module search path.

title: Note: on Windows, this is a ‘;’-separated list instead.

inline_content.Text: Note: on Windows, this is a ‘;’-separated list instead.

title: NODE_DISABLE_COLORS=1
Added in: v0.3.0 When set to 1 colors will not be used in the REPL.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.3.0 When set to 1 colors will not be used in the REPL.

title: NODE_ICU_DATA=file
Added in: v0.11.15 Data path for ICU (Intl object) data. Will extend linked-in data when compiled with small-icu support.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v0.11.15 Data path for ICU (Intl object) data. Will extend linked-in data when compiled with small-icu support.

title: NODE_REPL_HISTORY=file

Added in: v5.0.0 Path to the file used to store the persistent REPL history. The default path is ~/.node_repl_history, which is overridden by this variable. Setting the value to an empty string (”” or “ “) disables persistent REPL history.

inline_content.Text: Added in: v5.0.0 Path to the file used to store the persistent REPL history. The default path is ~/.node_repl_history, which is overridden by this variable. Setting the value to an empty string (”” or “ “) disables persistent REPL history.
